snippet: Among the challenges facing the Broadway transfer of Bruce Norris’s “Clybourne Park,” the actors had to confront their own reactions to the play’s charged dialogue about race.
abstract: Actors in Bruce Norris play Clybourne Park confront their own reactions to the play's racially charged dialogue; play has had an unusually long and rough road to Broadway.
lead_paragraph: Among the challenges facing the Broadway transfer of Bruce Norris’s “Clybourne Park,” the actors had to confront their own reactions to the play’s charged dialogue about race.

headline.seo: ‘Clybourne Park’ Looks at Race Relations in ’59 and Today
headline.main: Seven Actors Face a Big Challenge: He Just Said That?
headline.print_headline: Seven Actors Face A Big Challenge: He Just Said That?
